lines.text: New York/RyeBrook Orientation Program
Corporate Affairs Remarks
UA
First I'd like Xo congratulate each of you on your new
position, and to vish you a long and rewarding career here
at Philip Morris/
I have been with the Philip Morris USA
Corporate Affairs department for
, years, and one
thing I can promise you, based on my experience, is that you
will never have a dull day here.
There is always something exciting going on. Sometimes
we wish there wasn't quite so much activity, but because of
the nature of our industry, and because of the political
climate right now in Washington and elsewhere around the
country, we've been kept busy.
When you told your friends and family that you had
Separakne
corp.
accepted a job with Philip Morris, you probably heard many
good things about our company, ranging from "What a huge
company" to "Don't they make Jell-O" to "What a great
stock." But you may have also heard comments like: "Don't
they make CIGARETTEs," or the one I hear all the time, "Do
you have to smoke if you work there?"
Philip Morris(is very much in the news these days, and
CUSA
Much.f
a-let of the coverage,we've received has not been positive,
nor has it been fair or balanced. I'm sure that you've got
lots of questions about things you've read about in the
newspaper in recent months. I'd like to give you a brief
